eu.df.jiffybox.internal

Class ModuleJiffyBoxesImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.df.jiffybox.internal.ModuleJiffyBoxesImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ModuleJiffyBoxes

    public class ModuleJiffyBoxesImpl
extends java.lang.Object
implements ModuleJiffyBoxes
    Implementation of the jiffy boxes module.
    See Also:
    ModuleJiffyBoxes

    • Method Detail

      • getJiffyBoxes

        public Response<java.util.Map<java.lang.String,JiffyBox>> getJiffyBoxes()
                                                                 throws java.io.IOException
        Description copied from interface: ModuleJiffyBoxes
        This method provides an overview of all set up JiffyBoxes. Since this method is rather time consuming continuous usage is deprecated. Use the more specific call for a single JiffyBox instead.
        Specified by:
        getJiffyBoxes in interface ModuleJiffyBoxes
        Returns:
        The retrieved JiffyBoxes.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - When either the API limits are exceeded or the server is unreachable.

      • getJiffyBox

        public Response<JiffyBox> getJiffyBox(int id)
                               throws java.io.IOException
        Description copied from interface: ModuleJiffyBoxes
        This method provides details of a single JiffyBox. The result is equivalent to a single JiffyBox from get() but if there is more than one JiffyBox the execution speed is significantly higher.
        Specified by:
        getJiffyBox in interface ModuleJiffyBoxes
        Parameters:
        id - Box-ID
        Returns:
        The retrieved JiffyBox.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - When either the API limits are exceeded or the server is unreachable.

      • deleteJiffyBox

        public Response<java.lang.Boolean> deleteJiffyBox(int id)
                                           throws java.io.IOException
        Description copied from interface: ModuleJiffyBoxes
        This method deletes a specified JiffyBox. This command is asynchronous . The result is true on success and false otherwise. Success just means that the request for deletion was successful. The deletion itself happens in an asynchronous manner. The deletions state can be obtained by reading the JiffyBox. As soon as the notice occurs, that the JiffyBox no longer exists, the deletion was successful. During the deletion the JiffyBoxes status is DELETING. In case the status switches back to READY the deletion failed.
        Specified by:
        deleteJiffyBox in interface ModuleJiffyBoxes
        Parameters:
        id - Box-ID
        Returns:
        If the deletion was successfully initiated.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - When either the API limits are exceeded or the server is unreachable.

      • createJiffyBox

        public Response<JiffyBox> createJiffyBox(Finished<JiffyBoxBuilder> data)
                                  throws java.io.IOException
        Description copied from interface: ModuleJiffyBoxes
        This method creates a JiffyBox. The JiffyBox is created in an asynchronous manner. A success as a result solely means, that the creation was initialized. The result can be obtained by get(int id). id is contained in this methods result. During the creation the JiffyBoxes status is set to CREATING. As soon as the JiffyBox is set up the state changes to READY. On failure the JiffyBox is removed automatically.
        Specified by:
        createJiffyBox in interface ModuleJiffyBoxes
        Parameters:
        data - The JSON data from the builder.
        Returns:
        The created JiffyBox.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - When either the API limits are exceeded or the server is unreachable.

      • duplicateJiffyBox

        public Response<JiffyBox> duplicateJiffyBox(int id,
                                            java.lang.String name,
                                            int planId)
                                     throws java.io.IOException
        Description copied from interface: ModuleJiffyBoxes
        This method duplicates an existing JiffyBox. The JiffyBox is created in an asynchronous manner. A success as a result solely means, that the creation was initialized. The result can be obtained by get(int id). id is contained in this methods result. During the creation the JiffyBoxes status is set to CREATING. As soon as the JiffyBox is set up the state changes to READY. On failure the JiffyBox is removed automatically.
        Specified by:
        duplicateJiffyBox in interface ModuleJiffyBoxes
        Parameters:
        id - The id of the JiffyBox to duplicate.
        name - The name of the JiffyBoxes to create. Up to 30 characters are allowed. Allowed characters are a-zA-Z0-9üöäÜÖÄß_()=!\*@.- and spaces. The JiffyBoxes name has to be unique.
        planId - The plan of a JiffyBox is either an unique number or the plans name (CloudLevel 1, CloudLevel 2 etc.). The IDs and other details of the plan can be obtained via the plans module.
        Returns:
        The duplicated JiffyBox.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - When either the API limits are exceeded or the server is unreachable.

      • duplicateJiffyBox

        public Response<JiffyBox> duplicateJiffyBox(int id,
                                            java.lang.String name,
                                            int planId,
                                            com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.node.ObjectNode metadata)
                                     throws java.io.IOException
        Description copied from interface: ModuleJiffyBoxes
        This method duplicates an existing JiffyBox. The JiffyBox is created in an asynchronous manner. A success as a result solely means, that the creation was initialized. The result can be obtained by get(int id). id is contained in this methods result. During the creation the JiffyBoxes status is set to CREATING. As soon as the JiffyBox is set up the state changes to READY. On failure the JiffyBox is removed automatically.
        Specified by:
        duplicateJiffyBox in interface ModuleJiffyBoxes
        Parameters:
        id - The id of the JiffyBox to duplicate.
        name - The name of the JiffyBoxes to create. Up to 30 characters are allowed. Allowed characters are a-zA-Z0-9üöäÜÖÄß_()=!\*@.- and spaces. The JiffyBoxes name has to be unique.
        planId - The plan of a JiffyBox is either an unique number or the plans name (CloudLevel 1, CloudLevel 2 etc.). The IDs and other details of the plan can be obtained via the plans module.
        metadata - Each JiffyBox can contain optional data, which is returned on each request. This data is saved as hash for maximum flexibility. The value can be a complex type and will be returned just as it has been provided. The whole data may not exceed 4kb in size. Please notice, that this size refers to the generated JsonObject.
        Returns:
        The duplicated JiffyBox.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - When either the API limits are exceeded or the server is unreachable.

      • startJiffyBox

        public Response<JiffyBox> startJiffyBox(int id)
                                 throws java.io.IOException
        Description copied from interface: ModuleJiffyBoxes
        This method starts a JiffyBox. This command acts in an entirely asynchronous manner. To change a JiffyBoxes plan an PUT request is required as well. It sets the new plan. The modified values are status and planId. This command is executed entirely asynchronous.
        Specified by:
        startJiffyBox in interface ModuleJiffyBoxes
        Parameters:
        id - Box-ID
        Returns:
        The updated JiffyBox.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - When either the API limits are exceeded or the server is unreachable.

      • startJiffyBox

        public Response<JiffyBox> startJiffyBox(int id,
                                        com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.node.ObjectNode metadata)
                                 throws java.io.IOException
        Description copied from interface: ModuleJiffyBoxes
        This method starts a JiffyBox. This command acts in an entirely asynchronous manner. To change a JiffyBoxes plan an PUT request is required as well. It sets the new plan. The modified values are status and planId. This command is executed entirely asynchronous.
        Specified by:
        startJiffyBox in interface ModuleJiffyBoxes
        Parameters:
        id - Box-ID
        metadata - The meta data belonging to a JiffyBox can be changed or extended. Meta data is provided as Map<String, Object>. It is saved exactly in the same way. In case a keys value is NULL the according entry will be deleted. The values of keys not submitted will not change. The entire meta data may not exceed 4 kB. Please notice, that the space is referring to the generated JSON string.
        Returns:
        The updated JiffyBox.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - When either the API limits are exceeded or the server is unreachable.

                                       int planId)

        Parameters:

        planId - The plan of a JiffyBox is either an unique number or the plans name (CloudLevel 1, CloudLevel 2 etc.). The IDs and other details of the plan can be obtained via the plans module.
